titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: George Frederick Somers was the H. Fletcher Brown Professor of Biology at the University of Delaware, with co-appointments in Biology, Marine Studies, Nursing, Medical Technology, and Physical Therapy departments. He was also a Rhodes Scholar.

scopecontent.p: The G. Frederick Somers papers consist of material related to his research on the development of salt-tolerant plants, dating from 1943-1985 with the bulk of the material from 1973-1985. The collection contains research notebooks, project summaries, grant proposals, slides, photographs, and maps.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An online finding aid is available at http://www.lib.udel.edu/ud/spec/findaids/somers.htm.
